main_definition: To determine the total number of something or to acknowledge an action.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To tally or enumerate a quantity of objects, items, or occurrences.
meanings_and_examples.example: I counted all the apples in the basket and found there were 20.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To acknowledge something as important, noteworthy, or significant.
meanings_and_examples.example: His speech was finally given its due credit and counted by many attendees as one of the best they've ever heard.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In terms of time, to mark or note a point in succession or sequence.
meanings_and_examples.example: We need to count down from ten before we launch the rocket.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To record an action or event for future reference or accountability.
meanings_and_examples.example: The teacher counted every student present at the start of class and noted their attendance.
